page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: The most important{roads}are the A4101 Kingswinford to Dudley and the A491 through Kingswinford Cross which joins the A449 trunk road to Wolverhampton. These carry mainly commuter traffic. The B4175 from Wallheath to Gornal carries mainly goods traffic for the Pensnett Trading Estate. The only{railway}in use serves the Pensnett Trading Estate. It is the truncated Stourbridge to Wolverhampton line. Several West Midland{bus routes}pass through the area. There is one disused branch of the Stourbridge{Canal}which ends at Wide Waters near Pensnett and the Fens Pools.
